fields.description:
There are two possibly related issues here.

# Creating an inline comment
#* Select some lines
#* Comment form will show
#* Select another line
#* An additional comment form will be added.
*expected behaviour*: the comment form should move and the lines should be updated for that new comment
# Editing an existing inline comment
#* Click edit comment
#* Comment form will show
#* Select another line
#* An additional comment form will be added.
*expected behaviour*: the comment form should move and the lines should be updated for that new comment
fields.summary: Creating/editing inline snippet comments breaks when changing line selection

fields.description:
When a patch fails to anchor the error message is 'Errors: foo.patch can not be anchored to REPO_NAME', and the same message may be repeated several times.

In fact this isn't really an error. The message should be changed to something like: "10 files couldn't be anchored to REPO because their paths don't match any paths in the repository."
fields.summary: Failing to anchor a patch gives a confusing, repeated error message.

fields.summary: Should be able to mark files as text when the scm reports binary

fields.description:
We currently utilize LDAP for our user repository and allow users to be automatically added to crucible if they can successfully authenticate.  We have recently received complaints from users that their names were showing up two times in reviews.  After some analysis we saw that there were 2 instances of their IDs.  One was all lower case and the other was all upper case.  Steps to recreate are as follows:

1)  Log into crucible for the first time using LDAP with user id (joesmith)
1a) this causes the user id joesmith to be added to the user repository
2)  Log out of the system
3)  Log into crucible using user id (JOESMITH)
3)  Log out
4)  Log in as administrator
5)  Go to users area in administration screens
6)  You will see two users setup, one labeled joesmith and the other is JOESMITH.


I did see a similar log (http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-9469), but wasn't sure if it was linked to the same or a similar issue.
fields.summary: Signing in with username with different case creates new user

fields.description: !http://img.skitch.com/20100408-js8r8r3578kfxh75mgrt52bicc.jpg!
fields.summary: Unread comments notification when no unread comments appear to be present
GWTify admin screen

fields.description: eg. at the moment, you can only add 1 file to a snippet review. adding a second causes an UnsupportedOperationException. api clients should be able to get a list of available operations prior to attempting them.
fields.summary: expose a set of supported operations for reviews via the api

fields.description:
As long as I've been using Crucible I've seen people forget to Start Reviews after creating them.  I've been a creator of reviews who has forgotten to click Start Review. I've also received requests to perform reviews that I've been unable to perform since they're not yet started.

I'm not sure how to solve this problem.  I think it has already been mitigated recently because it seems to happen less.
Maybe a "You are leaving an unstarted review, do you really want to do that?" message?  Maybe making the start review button more visible? Maybe daily emails to people who have created reviews but haven't Started them.  Perhaps, now that there is a review creation dialog, it could be required that the reviews be finished before the dialog is closed, and the "unstarted" state could be removed.
fields.summary: Make it harder to forget to "Start Review"

fields.description: It would be very helpful if I could prepopulate the defect message when a particular defect classification is selected. For example, I would like the message to automatically populate with a link to additional documentation on the issue. That way when a developer sees a particular defect classification, they can read up on additional information on what it is and how to fix it if they aren't already aware.
fields.summary: Prepopulate messages when a defect classification is selected

fields.description:
Hi there!

I described my root problem in http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=42689

According to PL-1720 I checked the REST Version URL and there I receive a NPE:

{code}2010-04-06 09:55:47,501 ERROR [btpool0-91] org.mortbay.log org.mortbay.log.Slf4jLog-warn - /crucible/rest-service/reviews-v1/versionInfo
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.sun.jersey.spi.container.ContainerRequest.<init>(ContainerRequest.java:172)
        at com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.WebComponent.service(WebComponent.java:288)
        at com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.ServletContainer.service(ServletContainer.java:425)
        at com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.ServletContainer.service(ServletContainer.java:604)
        at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:820)
        at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHolder.handle(ServletHolder.java:502)
        at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler$Chain.doFilter(ServletHandler.java:1208)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.filters.RestFilter.doFilter(RestFilter.java:25)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.filters.CrucibleRestFilter.doFilter(CrucibleRestFilter.java:21)
        at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler$Chain.doFilter(ServletHandler.java:1200)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.IteratingFilterChain.doFilter(IteratingFilterChain.java:46)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.doFilter(ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.java:55)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.doFilter(ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.java:41)
        at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler$Chain.doFilter(ServletHandler.java:1200){code}

Probably I'm doing something wrong, but I miss further information how to proceed.

Thanks for your support!
- Ben

fields.description:
It breaks a whole lot of functionality in Crucible, and we don't handle it gracefully.  

If you do so, you get random null pointer exceptions 

e.g trying to add a patch to a review: 

{noformat}java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.cenqua.crucible.revision.source.PatchSource.makeFileRevisionInfo(PatchSource.java:412)
	at com.cenqua.crucible.model.managers.PatchManager.makeFromRevision(PatchManager.java:60)
	at com.cenqua.crucible.model.managers.PatchManager.createFileRevisions(PatchManager.java:50)
	at com.cenqua.crucible.model.managers.PatchManager.createPatch(PatchManager.java:40)
	at com.atlassian.crucible.spi.impl.DefaultReviewService$6.doInTransaction(DefaultReviewService.java:342)
	at com.atlassian.crucible.spi.impl.DefaultReviewService$6.doInTransaction(DefaultReviewService.java:330)
{noformat} 

The UI will just spin if you try to add an attachment or patch to a review etc.

fields.description:
The {{com.atlassian.crucible.spi.data.ProjectData}} SPI class does not expose {{com.cenqua.crucible.model.Project.contentRoots}}, which is used to narrow the scope of fisheye repo down to a (set of) sub directories.

This lack causes problems for auto review creator plugins. See: [https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/RC-3]
fields.summary: Add ContentRoot info to ProjectData

fields.description:
When an evaluation license expires, FishEye/Crucible sends you to the setup screen and prompts you to enter new keys. 

!http://img.skitch.com/20100325-nqk2xmwjetwux9yx886ssie1is.jpg!

However if you decide you do not wish to use Crucible and want to keep only FishEye, it keeps prompting for a new key if you leave the Crucible key blank. This means you need to edit the config.xml directly to remove the Crucible license to get your Fisheye only instance up and running. 

Not providing a Crucible key should disable Crucible as it would when you edit the license keys via Administration -> Sys-Info/Support -> Edit Licenses.
fields.summary: Cannot remove evaluation license once evaluation ends

fields.description:
This will prevent negative results on queries using the candidate key from being cached, which will allow us to remove the cache eviction fix for CRUC-3240, and also means that cached CrucibleRevision queries will not be invalidated by inserts.

Check all the entities which use a unique properties collection.
Queries on the candidate key will need to be changed to use Criteria.
Need to check that we still get unique constraints on keys.
This may require a schema upgrade.

See http://docs.jboss.org/hibernate/stable/core/reference/en/html/querycriteria.html#query-criteria-naturalid
fields.summary: Use <natural-id> instead of <properties ... unique="true"> for immutable candidate keys

fields.description:
because snippets are typically small, inline comments can easily break the readability of a snippet.

Change layout to two columns. LHS contains snippet, RHS contains comments. 
- linked scrolling so that relevant comments are visible for a given line. 
- use comment markers similar to the awesome-sbs-diff markers to link comments with their selected lines.
- RHS scrolling will show all comments, and scroll source accordingly.
- multiple top-level comments on the same line are placed most-recent first?
- comment threads should be collapsible?
- comment entry form appears in the RHS
- not sure what this means for the layout of general comments. Might look whacky if there are comments below and in right column. (do we need general comments for snippets?)
fields.summary: comments should be in a vertical column next to snippet

fields.description:
I just upgraded from Crucible 2.0 to Crucible 2.0 and experienced an issue when starting crucible because it was unable to connect to the internet to check the update site.  The error is provided below:

2010-03-20 15:03:55,151 ERROR [ProductUpdatePoller] fisheye.app com.cenqua.fisheye.util.ProductUpdatePoller$1-run - Error while checking for newer versions from http://update.atlassian.com (Connection timed out: connect)

If crucible is setup to receive automatic updates should it fail to start if it cannot connect to the update site?  I don't think this is the intended functionality, because internet outages can be common depending on the environment you are working in.


The steps to replicate would be as follows:

Install crucible and tell it to automatically update
Disconnect server from internet
Try to start crucible.  

After you try to start crucible you should see an error like I provided above and your users will not be able to get into the crucible application.  

My workaround for this was to go into the config.xml file and change the enabled attribute of the check-for-updates element to false.

<check-for-updates enabled="false"/>
fields.summary: Crucible Fails to start when automatically update is set to true and connection to update site cannot be made
CrucibleRevisions created in a transaction are not visible (via a query on source, path and revision) later in that tx, because of the query cache

fields.description:
*Steps*

1. Set a default moderator for a project.
2. Set the permission scheme on the project so that only the moderator can _approve_ and _reject_ reviews; and only the creator can _abandon_ reviews.
3. Create a review and send it to the moderator.
4. As the moderator, view the review.

*Expected*
- When the edit review dialog shows for the moderator, they should only have the options to _start_ or _reject_ the review.

*Actual*
- They are given options to _start_ or _abandon_ the review.
- When clicking _abandon_, an error is shown stating the user doesn't have permission to do so.
fields.summary: Moderator given 'abandon' option even if not permitted.

See: https://forum.jquery.com/topic/validating-json-unnecessarily-is-killing-firefox

Possible solutions:
# Point cut {{jQuery.parseJSON}} to skip the regular expression
# Use {{eval()}} for frx responses (or all responses)

fields.description:
I loaded the review before Craig had made any comments, but then was notified (and hit "update") several times to get a succession of Craig's comments. The comments were loaded, but the comment count never updated:

fields.summary: comment count in overview pane is sometimes inaccurate

fields.description:
Changing to an improvement request because it turns out its not a bug, but the customer data was somehow missing certain constraints on the database. 

You get the following error. 

{noformat}Caused by: com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.CruDBException: SQL script error on line 12: "alter table cru_completed_frx drop foreign key FK927E9E9F1BD6EA47;" 
(Error on rename of './fisheye/cru_completed_frx' to './fisheye/#sql2-148e-586' (errno: 152)), please contact http://www.atlassian.com/support/
        at com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.DefaultDBControl.executeScript(DefaultDBControl.java:395)
        at com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.DefaultDBControl.executeScript(DefaultDBControl.java:347)
        at com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.DefaultDBControl.doUpgrade(DefaultDBControl.java:332)
        at com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.DefaultDBControl.upgrade(DefaultDBControl.java:306)
        ... 93 more
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: Error on rename of './fisheye/cru_completed_frx' to './fisheye/#sql2-148e-586' (errno: 152)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.SQLError.createSQLException(SQLError.java:1055)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.SQLError.createSQLException(SQLError.java:956)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:3558)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:3490)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sendCommand(MysqlIO.java:1959)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sqlQueryDirect(MysqlIO.java:2109)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.ConnectionImpl.execSQL(ConnectionImpl.java:2642)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.StatementImpl.executeUpdate(StatementImpl.java:1647)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.StatementImpl.executeUpdate(StatementImpl.java:1566)
        at com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.DefaultDBControl.executeScript(DefaultDBControl.java:377)
        ... 96 more{noformat} 

If its possible, we should check to see if the constraint exists before trying to drop it. If it doesn't exist its no big deal in this case because we were dropping the table right afterwards.
fields.summary: Upgrades can fail when constraints are missing on the database.

fields.description:
I am facing issues with uploading a patch for an incrementally modified file (before commit)
for which had a patch had been already uploaded in the same review request.

Steps:
======
    a/ Uploaded a patch for a locally modified file. The diffs came up properly
    b/ Made further changes and uploaded another patch in the same review request.
       Now what I could see in the file content section, is the entire file with no diff, not even a diff of the 110 lines, say, with the repository.
    (please refer the attachments provided for the issue)
fields.summary: Regarding iterative per commit reviews using patches

fields.description:
In most of our listings of changesets, we show any reviews that are associated with the particular changesets. some examples are:
# Activity stream
# Changeset page
# JIRA FishEye plugin

It would be consistent, and very convenient to also have this information in the Manage Files > Suggested Changesets dialog in Crucible. Before I add a changeset to a review, I would like to confirm that a suggestion is not already being reviewed, and I cannot do this without navigating first to another page.

!screenshot006.png!
fields.summary: Suggested changesets should list reviews

fields.description:

I toggled the menu item 'Show/Hide deleted files', but deleted files remain visible

fields.description: The loading spinner shows on side-by-side diffs when the number of lines in a side of the diff is just under half the number of lines visible in the viewport.
fields.summary: Loading spinner shown in side-by-side diff for short files

fields.description: Currently I have to go through each folder in a project and add a file if I want to review an entire project (the entire trunk of a project).  It would save time if I could just recursively add everything in a directory.
fields.summary: A user can add an entire directory (and sub-directories) of file when adding files to a review

fields.description:
*Steps*
1. From the checkstyle repository, create a review containing {{/trunk/checkstyle/src/xdocs/releasenotes.xml}}, revisions 2498 and 2500.
2. Start the review.
3. View the file to mark it read.
4. Reload the review.
5. Edit the content of the review and add revision 2501 of {{releasenotes.xml}}.
6. Reload the review and view the file to mark it as read.
7. Reload the review.

*Expected*
- After step 7, the _New revisions have been added to files since you last read them_ notice should go away.

*Actual*
- The notice remains.

I'm also not sure that this notice should be displayed at all, seeing that you are the one who has added the revisions.
fields.summary: Revisions added notice won't go away in a review

fields.description:
View a review with an outdated file and you get a link to update it.

Click to update and the file responds, and the page knows you are yet to review that FRX. If you were at 100% in the avatar status bar, it will refresh to reveal a little red once more. 

Trouble is the navigation tree doesn't update to show the file as unread.
fields.summary: Manually updating an outdated FRX doesn't update the navigation tree
Create CSS for the Gadget

fields.description:
Compare the activity of the following pages:
- https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/browse/FE/branches/twenty-webdriver/build.xml
- https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/changelog/FE/branches/twenty-webdriver/build.xml

The former, by default, doesn't list the activity on the branch since the branch point, whereas the latter only shows activity since branching (which is arguably the correct thing to do).
fields.summary: Revisions list of branch doesn't show activity since branching
JS Error in Chrom browser

fields.description:
To be able to provider better UX for users we need Crucible and FishEye to publish public (available to remote clients) SCM repository URL for both FishEye and Crucible repositories.

This information is already stored in Crucible and FishEye. Administrators may decide to publish it for users but unfortunately we can't get it from REST API. It would be great if it was published in /repositories-v1/ It doesn't have to be mandatory (we may decide not to support repositories without this information published).

URL should be in form https://studio.atlassian.com/svn/PLE (with the path part included). We need it to define a mapping between local resource with SCM path say https://studio.atlassian.com/svn/PLE/trunk/com.atlassian/MANIFEST.MF to path accepted by Crucible. In this case /trunk/com.atlassian/MANIFEST.MF

This information should be available for all repository types (including plugins).
fields.summary: REST API should publish public repository URL
Add option to restict user mappings to the admin UI

fields.description:
We all know that Crucible is very capable of spamming you with thousands of emails whenever someone starts commenting on a review.  One mitigation to the problem is to filter Crucible notifications into a folder, so that they don't clutter your inbox.  However, that requires accurately identifying that an email is from Crucible.  The two candidate fields for filtering this sort of mail are usually subject and from email address.  In Crucible, you can't use subject because it looks like this:  [ABC-123] Comment: issue title.  That could be anything, including a JIRA notification.  You can't use the from email address, because Crucible sets the from email address to be the email address of the person that made the comment.

There is one way to accurately identify, that is to filter by X-Mailer, because crucible sets that field to "Cenqua-Crucible", however, it doesn't uniquely identify a Crucible instance, and not all email clients, most notably GMail, support filtering by arbitrary headers.

My suggestion is that seeing as the user that commented didn't actually send the email, rather Crucible did, the sender should not be set to that users email address, but should rather be a configured email address.  This will allow unique and accurate identification of Crucible instances by email filters.  If Crucible wants replies to go to the user that caused the email to be sent, then the users email address should be set in the Reply-To field, not the From field, because like I said, that's wrong, they didn't send the email.
fields.summary: Crucible email notifications not easy to filter
